title: Special values of derivatives of certain $L$-functions
abstract:
In this paper we address the question of non-vanishing of $L'(0,f)$ where $f$
is an algebraic valued periodic function. In 2011, Gun, Murty and Rath studied
the nature of special values of the derivatives of even Dirichlet-type
functions and proved that it can be either zero or transcendental. Here for
some special cases we characterize the set of functions for which $L'(0,f)$ is
zero or transcendental. Using a theorem of Ramachandra about multiplicative
independence of cyclotomic units we also provide some non-trivial examples of
functions where $L'(0,f)$ is zero. Finally, assuming Schanuel's conjecture we
derive the algebraic independence of special values of derivatives of
$L$-functions.
